intro: Draba junussovii, commonly known as the Junussov's whitlow grass, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Draba junussovii has a compact growth habit with basal leaves and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid and semi-arid regions.
